hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Transition via 7-Day Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and its 7-day realized volatility compresses below 30% (annualized) for at least 5 consecutive days, a subsequent daily close above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper envelope (2 std dev) will signal a transition to a BULL regime with an 80% probability of a +8% price move within 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral regimes often precedes significant directional moves. A breakout from compression during neutral conditions suggests accumulation and reduced selling pressure, increasing the likelihood of a sustained bullish impulse rather than a false breakout.
entry_conditions: BTC 7-day realized volatility < 30% (annualized) for ≥5 consecutive days
BTC daily close > 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Daily close below 20-day simple moving average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If fewer than 60% of such signals result in a BULL regime classification within 5 days OR the average 10-day return after signal is ≤+4%.
